intro: Pedicularis binaria, commonly known as the two-flowered lousewort, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and alpine meadows. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with two lips that are characteristic of the genus Pedicularis. The plant has a short, hairy stem and produces small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
